thread.title: This hairstylist turns his clients’ hair into beautiful rainbows | New York Post
thread.title_full: This hairstylist turns his clients’ hair into beautiful rainbows | New York Post

title: This hairstylist turns his clients’ hair into beautiful rainbows | New York Post
text: 0:50 This hairstylist turns his clients' hair into beautiful rainbows Guy Tang is a hairstylist who is known for creating radiant 'dos for his clients. He styles and dyes their hair with vibrant colors to create out-of-this-world looks. 1:18 The NRA isn't just for white people, according to 'Black Guns Matter' In an effort to protect urban residents from gun violence, Maj Toure founded Black Guns Matter. The group aims to help educate people about their Second Amendment rights and firearm use and safety. 0:49 Twerking waiter adds a little sparkle to this lady's birthday When Daivion Gregory took his girlfriend out to dinner for her birthday, their waiter brought the couple an extra surprise along with the cake. He twerked for them, and the rest of the restaurant. 0:30 Badass hyena pops out from inside elephant carcass A group of hyenas and jackals came across a fresh elephant corpse in South Africa and started feeding off it. In an example of how ravenous these animals are, one of the hyenas was caught on camera popping out from inside the elephant's corpse after eating its way inside. 1:00 Doofus learns how not to use a ladder Sometimes, it can be hard to tell if a ladder is properly secured and safe to climb on. Other times, like in this video where a New York man decided to balance a ladder on top of two stacked tables, it can be pretty obvious. 1:00 This senior center is modeled on a Vegas casino Calling it "Day Service Las Vegas," a Japanese senior center has added casino-style games to keep their elderly clients engaged and entertained. The happy customers play poker, mahjong and Pachinko slot machines, and drinks are served bar-style over the counter. There are currently 12 similar day-care facilities in Japan. 0:50 Returning soldier disguises himself as Ninja Turtle to surprise daughter Amelia Messenger's father, Oscar, wanted to surprise his daughter after coming home from a nine-month deployment. So he showed up at her martial arts class dressed as a Ninja Turtle and unmasked himself in front of his unsuspecting daughter. 0:54 Pregnant woman has a breakdown over her favorite candy bar Pregnancy affects people in different, sometimes surprising ways. When Rachel Wardell came across her favorite candy bar while shopping, for example, she was so overjoyed that she started crying. 0:39 Prison fight breaks out between a deputy and a jailer A Kentucky jailer is facing multiple charges after an altercation with a local deputy. It's not clear who started the fight, but it reportedly was caused when Deputy Smith tried to hand over a prisoner's backpack to Joseph Funk, the prison worker. 0:42 You'll never pay baggage fees again with this airport jacket The 14-pocket Airport Jacket holds up to 33 pounds of luggage, and can be converted from a bag to a coat when boarding the plane. The jacket, which is being funded on Kickstarter , can be worn three different ways: hip-length, ¾-length or full.
